intro: Lessingia micradenia, commonly known as the narrowleaf lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink and bloom in early spring. The species is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in open, sunny areas.
